Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of removal officer's decision to deny deferral of removal
Evidence_Assessment: Conflicting medical evidence regarding the male applicant's health
Credibility_Factor: Unresolved controversy over medical condition due to non-disclosure of evidence
Legal_Rule: Section 48(2) of IRPA requires removal to be 'reasonably practicable'
Procedural_Issue: Failure to disclose evidence to counsel; improper H&C analysis outside proper forum
Grounds_for_Claim: Health risks upon removal; pending humanitarian and compassionate (H&C) application
Outcome_on_Merits: Decision found untenable and in reviewable error
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Procedural unfairness due to lack of disclosure and improper analysis
Applicant_Challenge: Denial of deferral of removal to Costa Rica
Court_Result: Remanded for re-determination after H&C application is decided
Outcome: Removal deferral denied initially, decision quashed, case remanded
Decision_Authority: Removal Officer, subject to Federal Court review
Remedy_Sought: Re-determination of removal deferral after H&C decision
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: None directly alleged; health and H&C concerns raised
Governing_Rule: Reasonableness simpliciter standard for administrative decisions involving mixed questions
